alert.note: Alert for Walton (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 4:47AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following county, Walton. * WHEN...Until 545 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 346 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... De Funiak Springs, Eglin Air Force Base, Freeport, Ponce De Leon, Rock Hill, New Home, Pleasant Ridge, Portland, Eucheeanna, Douglass Crossroad, Knox Hill, Red Bay and Villa Tasso. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
